meanings.definition: A medieval polearm weapon with a blade and hook.
meanings.sent1: The knight wielded the gisarme with skill in battle.
meanings.sent2: The gisarme was a formidable weapon used in medieval warfare.
meanings.sent3: The blacksmith mistakenly crafted a gisarme with a rubber blade for the renaissance fair.
meanings.sent4: In the hands of the warrior, the gisarme became a deadly dance of death on the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The gisarme gleamed in the sunlight, ready to strike fear into the hearts of enemies.

meanings.sent1: The armorer will gisarme the soldiers before they march into battle.
meanings.sent2: It is essential to gisarme the troops properly for the upcoming campaign.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy squire managed to gisarme the horses with the wrong harnesses.
meanings.sent4: With determination, the blacksmith worked tirelessly to gisarme the entire army.
meanings.sent5: The general instructed his men to gisarme themselves for the impending conflict.
